meanings.definition: A smaller group within a larger cluster.
meanings.sent1: The subclusters of stars in the galaxy are fascinating to astronomers.
meanings.sent2: The biologist studied the subclusters of cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The subclusters of colorful birds in the park made for a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the subclusters of trees resembled tiny villages.
meanings.sent5: The subclusters of fish in the coral reef created a mesmerizing underwater world.

meanings.definition: To form smaller groups within a larger cluster.
meanings.sent1: The students decided to subclusters themselves for the group project.
meanings.sent2: The bees subclusters around the queen bee to protect her.
meanings.sent3: The children subclusters around the birthday cake, eager for a slice.
meanings.sent4: The clouds subclusters in the sky, creating interesting shapes.
meanings.sent5: The ants subclusters to carry the food back to their nest efficiently.
